intro: Goodenia teucriifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved goodenia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in spikes along the stems. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Goodenia teucriifolia is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
